lens.book_chapters: Part 1: The Cold Start Problem and Atomic Networks.

opportunity_thesis: The biggest strategic opening is to make trust and commitment velocity visible at the exact local moments where roommate marketplaces usually fail. Roomi proves demand for fast introductions, but the category still leaves users to manually verify legitimacy, predict matchability, negotiate terms, and rebuild trust every cycle. Under Cold Start dynamics, these gaps keep atomic networks below tipping point even when top-line supply looks healthy. Split Lease can win by turning hidden trust labor into productized infrastructure that increases local conversion quality and compounds into a defensible reputation network over time.

opportunities.title: Legitimacy Graph Before First Message
opportunities.the_signature: Split Lease makes legitimacy a first-class network primitive, not a profile afterthought: every listing and person carries a visible trust-density card that combines identity depth, behavior reliability, and verification recency before contact starts. Users can see confidence in context (this neighborhood, this date window, this budget band), so the first decision is no longer 'is this real?' but 'is this a fit?' That creates a coffee-test moment because users expect to self-audit strangers, not receive pre-commitment legitimacy intelligence.
opportunities.why_competitors_wont_copy: Lead-gen marketplaces optimize for listing volume and message volume, not expensive trust operations that may reduce apparent inventory and short-term monetization. Adopting this deeply would force competitors to trade growth optics for quality controls, add moderation cost centers, and redesign ranking economics tied to boosts/premium visibility.
opportunities.behavioral_framework_case: Part 1 of Cold Start shows network value depends on relevant, trusted participants crossing local thresholds; weak trust lowers effective density even when nominal supply is high. By removing authenticity ambiguity at first touch, Split Lease raises the proportion of 'usable' nodes in each atomic network and improves the probability of a tipping event.
opportunities.user_evidence: Hosts and guests repeatedly asked for legitimacy proof: 'I don't know if this guy is legit,' 'there are so many scams around,' and 'do you do background check?' Users also said they must physically verify spaces to confirm legitimacy before committing.
anti_patterns: Do not turn this into a vanity badge wall; the signature is predictive trust quality, not more icons.
Do not hide low-confidence signals to protect conversion optics; transparency is the product advantage.

existing_library_overlap.gap_assessment: Partially addressed. The library covers human-to-digital trust continuity and transition safety, but not a market-wide, pre-message legitimacy graph visible at search/evaluation time.

opportunities.title: Atomic Liquidity Map and Matchability Forecast
opportunities.the_signature: Split Lease exposes real neighborhood-time-window liquidity before and during search, with a plain forecast of likely responses and expected time-to-match for each filter state. Instead of pretending global scale equals local success, the product tells users exactly where they are above or below threshold and suggests adjacent moves that improve outcomes. This feels radically honest in a category that markets city-wide activity but hides block-level thinness.
opportunities.why_competitors_wont_copy: Most competitors are acquisition-driven and depend on broad activity narratives; transparent submarket thinness can hurt top-of-funnel conversion and paid boost demand. Implementing truthful matchability also requires reliable freshness telemetry and willingness to reveal where the network is weak.
opportunities.behavioral_framework_case: Cold Start emphasizes that atomic networks tip only when enough relevant participants are active in the same slice. Forecasting local viability reduces uncertainty costs, prevents premature abandonment, and channels users toward interaction-dense zones where network effects can actually manifest.
opportunities.user_evidence: Users reported uncertainty about search quality and pricing context ('I'm not sure how the content is,' 'too many listings for me to remember') and the need to manually infer viability. This maps directly to hidden local-density risk.
anti_patterns: Do not ship generic inventory counters; the signature is actionable local matchability, not bigger numbers.
Do not present confidence scores without behavioral explanation; users must understand what improves forecast quality.

existing_library_overlap.gap_assessment: Reinforced but not solved. Existing elements reduce interpretation burden and pricing confusion, yet do not provide explicit pre-signup local-liquidity and response forecasting.

opportunities.title: Commitment Rail From Chat to Agreement
opportunities.the_signature: Split Lease turns the most fragile phase into a structured, high-clarity rail: terms are co-authored inside the conversation, milestones are explicit, and both sides see a live commitment state from first interest to accepted agreement. The platform keeps conversational speed while eliminating off-platform leakage and ambiguity around dates, deposits, expectations, and next actions. Users experience this as 'finally, someone made the scary part legible.'
opportunities.why_competitors_wont_copy: Competitors are optimized for introductions; owning commitment requires legal/ops depth, policy handling, and product accountability for failed agreements. It also shifts the business from lead-gen volume toward outcome quality, which can conflict with current monetization and organizational incentives.
opportunities.behavioral_framework_case: Part 1 frames durable networks as product + network duality: connections alone are insufficient without robust mechanics that convert interaction into reliable outcomes. A commitment rail increases conversion consistency and reinforces network defensibility by keeping high-value interactions on-platform.
opportunities.user_evidence: Transcripts show real workflows leaking into text ('Has that just been through texts? Yeah'), requests for pre-commit interviews, and explicit needs for better notification reliability. Users are signaling that chat alone is not enough for high-risk agreement moments.
anti_patterns: Do not bloat this into a rigid legal wizard; the signature is structured clarity at conversational speed.
Do not push users off-platform for final steps; leakage destroys the reinforcing loop.

existing_library_overlap.gap_assessment: Partially addressed. Library principles on conversational speed and model translation support execution, but a full end-to-end commitment operating rail remains a clear gap.

opportunities.title: Post-Stay Reputation That Actually Carries Forward
opportunities.the_signature: Split Lease captures lightweight co-living reliability signals during and after stays, then converts them into portable reputation that meaningfully improves future matching confidence. Good behavior earns durable trust capital across neighborhoods and future cycles, so returning users do not restart from zero. The signature is compounding trust memory in a category that treats each match as disposable.
opportunities.why_competitors_wont_copy: Most roommate products stop at match creation and avoid post-stay accountability due to moderation overhead, dispute complexity, and delayed monetization payback. Building portable reputation requires lifecycle ownership and cross-cycle data integrity that many marketplaces are not set up to maintain.
opportunities.behavioral_framework_case: Cold Start warns that unchecked growth degrades quality and that networks can unwind below activity thresholds. Post-stay reputation increases carrying capacity by filtering bad actors and preserving trust between cycles, which stabilizes atomic networks against repeated mini cold starts.
opportunities.user_evidence: Layer 1/2 evidence shows users fear scams, rely on manual checks, and experience trust reset on each search cycle. The absence of reusable trust history is a hidden but high-impact pain in return behavior.
anti_patterns: Do not reduce reputation to simplistic star ratings; the signature is contextual, behavior-linked trust carryover.
Do not collect post-stay data without user benefit in the next search; compounding value must be visible.

existing_library_overlap.gap_assessment: Mostly unsolved. Existing elements encourage engagement and advisor contribution, but do not define a durable post-stay trust graph that compounds across cycles.

opportunity_ranking.reason: Highest leverage on immediate conversion and trust-sensitive abandonment; strongest direct transcript validation and strongest Cold Start fit because it increases effective local network density before users churn.
Owns the category's weakest, highest-anxiety moment where value currently leaks off-platform; difficult to copy due to operating-model implications and creates strong defensibility if executed well.
Transforms discovery/search from optimism theater into actionable local certainty, improving early confidence and routing users toward tip-ready atomic networks.
Critical long-term moat through trust compounding and retention stability, but slower payback and higher implementation complexity than pre-commitment opportunities.

strategic_narrative:
Roomi demonstrates that fast introductions are no longer enough to win roommate marketplaces; the next category leader will own confidence, not just activity. Split Lease can become the platform that makes local network health and participant legitimacy visible before users invest emotional effort, so the first session feels credible instead of speculative. That is the front edge of the strategy: reduce hidden trust labor and increase the share of interactions that users treat as genuinely usable.

The middle of the strategy is commitment quality. If Split Lease structures negotiation and acceptance so outcomes remain in-platform and auditable, it converts fragile conversations into reliable agreements. This is where atomic networks either tip or stall: better commitment mechanics raise conversion consistency and create data that competitors who only monetize introductions never capture.

The back edge is compounding trust over time. By extending into active-lease and post-stay reputation loops, Split Lease turns one-off matches into cumulative trust capital that travels with users across neighborhoods and cycles. If these three layers work together, Split Lease is no longer a roommate listing app; it becomes the trust infrastructure for recurring co-living decisions.
